cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi E of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border (west-central Caribbean Sea)

motion.direction: W (280°) – expected to turn WNW then NW

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest, skirt the northeast Honduras coast, cross the Yucatán Peninsula Saturday night, then track north-north-westward across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast, most likely along the Louisiana coast near or east-southeast of New Orleans

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch currently limited to the Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla (Central America) – no U.S. watches yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. coastline in this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast across Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle is within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance shows lower totals for Louisiana)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (too early, low confidence with weak system)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts 20–30 mph possible late Monday night–Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected with current intensity forecast
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain to the New Orleans area Tuesday
